heading: cell phone for calling up tunes
subheading: samsung launches a cell phone in korea that can store up to 15 minutes of music files. a us version will be ready for people to rock in the new year with mp3s. by jennifer sullivan.
author: jennifer sullivan
text: digital music is making its way into car stereos, headphones, portable players, and home entertainment systems. now, thanks to samsung, music files can be played on a cell phone. earlier this month, samsung electronics, based in korea, unveiled a sexy little phone that can hold 16mb of music, or about 15 minutes worth of tunes.read wired news' ongoing mp3 coverage
